medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple episodes of vomiting on the first day of life with delayed passage of meconium, along with neurological symptoms including bilateral horizontal nystagmus and developmental delays.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Vomiting and delayed meconium passage occurred on the first day of life. Focal areas of skin hypopigmentation were noted in the late neonatal period. Neurological symptoms, including bilateral horizontal nystagmus and tremors, presented during early infancy, with progressive worsening of cerebellar signs and significant global developmental delay over time. First seizure occurred in late childhood, characterized by generalized tonic and clonic movements lasting 3 minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with Hirschsprung disease in the neonatal period, underwent transanal pull-through surgery at 3 months of age, diagnosed with vitiligo in neonatal period, diagnosed with partial albinism in early infancy, and diagnosed with bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss as a toddler.
